verses.name: Proverbs 20:17
verses.text: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:18
verses.text: Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:19
verses.text: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:20
verses.text: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:21
verses.text: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

verses.name: Proverbs 20:22
verses.text: Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the Lord, and he shall save thee.
